result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Allen Cornelius Jr

defendant.name: Cornelius, Gerald Allen, Jr

records.addlTxt:
Assistant District Attorney Tim Greenwood appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Gerald Allen Cornelius Jr in court. Defendant handed in petition for court appointed counsel. Paperwork returned to the Defendant to finish filling out by the next hearing. Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing continue. 
Present bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with C.M.C. or B.R.M. or their residence or place of employment.
GPS device to be installed prior to release. Not to be within 1000ft. of C.M.C. or B.R.M. and their place of residence.
